DataElement.preferredName: Post Procedure Analgesics Over the Counter Product Pills Recommendation Combination Medication Dose
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the amount of combination medicine as related to advice of analgesic agent (pain alleviating compounds) in form of small pellet which can be bought without a doctor's prescription, after procedure.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Post Procedure Analgesics Over the Counter Product Pills Recommendation
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to advice of the amount of analgesic agent (pain alleviating compounds) in form of small pellet which can be bought without a doctor's prescription, after procedure.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Post; occuring after.:A particular course of action intended to achieve a result.:Drugs that reduce pain. These drugs include aspirin, acetaminophen, and ibuprofen.

Concepts.definition: Happening at a time subsequent to a reference time; later in time or order.

An activity that produces an effect, or that is intended to alter the course of a disease in a patient or population. This is a general term that encompasses the medical, social, behavioral, and environmental acts that can have preventive, therapeutic, or palliative effects.

Compounds that alleviate pain without loss of consciousness.  Analgesics act by various mechanisms including binding with opioid receptors and decreasing inflammation.  Choice of analgesic may be determined by the type of pain.  These compounds include opioid, non-opioid and adjuvant analgesic agents.

Property.preferredName: Over the Counter Product Pills Recommendation
Property.preferredDefinition: A medicine or device that can be bought without a doctor's order or prescription.:A dose of medicine in the form of a small pellet.:Recommendation; advice telling someone what the best thing to do is.

Concepts.definition: A medicine or device that can be bought without a doctor's order or prescription.
A solid composed of a small, round object composed of active and/or inert ingredient(s).
Advice telling someone what the best thing to do is.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: actions or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process (NCI).

DataElementConcept.origin: PEARL CRF:Practitioners Engaged in Applied Research and Learning Network Case Report Form

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: the amount of combination medicine given or taken.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: actions or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process (NCI).

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: The amount of medicine taken, or radiation given, at one time.

Concepts.definition: A quantity of an agent (such as substance or energy) administered, taken, or absorbed at one time.
